text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Safety, Health and Welfare at 

Work (General Application) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 20 November 2023. 

(3) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the Safety, 

Health and Welfare at Work (General Application) Regulations 2007 to 2021. 

(4) In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Safety, Health 
and Welfare at Work (General Application) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 299 of 
2007).

heading: 2. The Principal Regulations are amended as follows -
text_raw:
2. The Principal Regulations are amended as follows - 

(a) Regulation 27 of the Principal Regulations is amended by 

inserting before “carrier” the following – 

“‘all-terrain vehicle’ means a motorised vehicle, propelled by an 
internal combustion engine with liquid fuel or by other means, 
intended primarily to travel on unpaved surfaces on four wheels 
with low-pressure tyres, having a seat designed to be straddled 
by the rider and handlebars for steering.” 

(b) Regulation 40 (b) of the Principal Regulations is amended by 

inserting after it the following – 

“(c) where work involves the operation of an all-terrain 

vehicle – 

(i) 

that the operator of the all-terrain vehicle has 
successfully completed an all-terrain vehicle safety 
training course provided by a registered training 
provider to a QQI Standard or equivalent, 

(ii) 

that a risk assessment is conducted in accordance 
with section 19 of the Act, 

(iii) 

that an assessment is conducted in accordance with 
Regulation 63, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th November, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [619] 3 

(iv) 

that personal protective equipment is provided to 
and worn by the operator of the all-terrain vehicle in 
accordance with Regulation 62.” 

(c) PART B of SCHEDULE 2 of the Principal Regulations is 
amended by inserting before “– Hairnets against risk of 
entanglement” the following – 

“– Where work involves the operation of an all-terrain vehicle, a 
protective helmet recommended by the all-terrain vehicle 
manufacturer, or designed for use with all-terrain vehicles in 
compliance with relevant European Community directives and 
European Union regulations regarding design and manufacture 
of personal protective equipment with respect to safety and 
health, said helmet to have a chin strap and to be capable of use 
with suitable eye protection” 

(d) PART C of SCHEDULE 2 of the Principal Regulations is 

amended – 

(i) 

by inserting after “– Work involving travelling on bicycles 
and mechanically propelled bikes” the following – 

“– Operation of all-terrain vehicles”, and 

(ii) 

by inserting after “– Dental and surgical procedures” the 
following – 

“– Operation of all-terrain vehicles”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 24 November 2021 

DAMIEN ENGLISH, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, Trade and 

Employment.

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The Regulations amend the Safety, Health and Welfare at Work (General 
Application) Regulations 2007 to 2021, introducing specific PPE requirements 
for operators of all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) when used as part of work 
practices.
